text: John A. Conkey was the president of the Boston Red Stockings of the National League in . Conkey was one of the founders of the Boston baseball club and succeeded Ivers Whitney Adams as club president after the team's first season due to Adams' business conflicts. Conkey was succeeded as team president by Charles Porter in 1873. ==References== ==External links== * Atlanta Braves owners Category:Major League Baseball team presidents Category:Boston Braves owners Category:Year of birth missing Category:Year of death missing
title: John Conkey
